title: convert panic into a tracing log
body:
Fixes networking panic:

https://github.com/holochain/holochain/blob/07d9be37a68e4d6a0d12d005de4bfd479d733442/crates/kitsune_p2p/kitsune_p2p/src/spawn/actor/meta_net.rs#L688

```
[2023-04-24T23:21:00.187407+02:00] INFO - [HOLOCHAIN 0.2.0-beta-rc.6] FATAL PANIC PanicInfo {
[2023-04-24T23:21:00.187649+02:00] INFO - [HOLOCHAIN 0.2.0-beta-rc.6] payload: Any { .. },
[2023-04-24T23:21:00.187850+02:00] INFO - [HOLOCHAIN 0.2.0-beta-rc.6] message: Some(
[2023-04-24T23:21:00.187894+02:00] INFO - [HOLOCHAIN 0.2.0-beta-rc.6] Custom { kind: Other, error: Ban },
[2023-04-24T23:21:00.187920+02:00] INFO - [HOLOCHAIN 0.2.0-beta-rc.6] ),
[2023-04-24T23:21:00.188074+02:00] INFO - [HOLOCHAIN 0.2.0-beta-rc.6] location: Location {
[2023-04-24T23:21:00.188141+02:00] INFO - [HOLOCHAIN 0.2.0-beta-rc.6] file: "/Users/runner/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/kitsune_p2p-0.2.0-beta-rc.5/src/spawn/actor/meta_net.rs",
[2023-04-24T23:21:00.188185+02:00] INFO - [HOLOCHAIN 0.2.0-beta-rc.6] line: 688,
[2023-04-24T23:21:00.188266+02:00] INFO - [HOLOCHAIN 0.2.0-beta-rc.6] col: 33,
[2023-04-24T23:21:00.188319+02:00] INFO - [HOLOCHAIN 0.2.0-beta-rc.6] },
[2023-04-24T23:21:00.188356+02:00] INFO - [HOLOCHAIN 0.2.0-beta-rc.6] can_unwind: true,
[2023-04-24T23:21:00.188387+02:00] INFO - [HOLOCHAIN 0.2.0-beta-rc.6] }
```

I've really tried to minimise the possibility of a break here. I think that the `hdi` and the `hdk` will behave the same as they did which is the main thing. People *may* have problems building `holochain` with a partial upgrade of its dependencies but I'm struggling to construct a problem scenario in my head.

title: Feature consistency for sqlite
body:
### Summary

~~This has the potentail to break things, for now it's just demonstrating the changes that are needed to make sure that when building this repo, sqlite is only built one way and is never linked to a system dependency~~

Consuming `hdi`/`hdk` should not change, the database should never be imported or built. Everywhere else you have to choose between `no-deps` to enable sqlite with bundling or `db-encryption` which bundles sqlite with encryption enabled. I've tried not to change any defaults for other binaries, e.g. `hc_sandbox` builds without encryption always and `holochain` builds without encryption when built with default features.

I'd still like to come back to this and see if any dependency paths to `rusqlite` can be removed. But for now, this PR should just be expressing what we already meant to do - just more explicitly which helps avoid build/linker issues when enabling `resolver = "2"`

### TODO:

title: Fix reference to missing Quic enum variant
body:
### Summary

Raised on https://github.com/holochain/holochain/issues/2229. Disabling the tx5 feature causes a reference to the `Quic` enum variant of `TransportConfig` to be introduced to sweetest which doesn't build at `Quic` is commented out. Commenting this out too to avoid compilation failures when using `default-features = false`.

This does mean ending up with no transport_pool configured which is worse in a way because it will probably be harder to work out why.

title: remove tx2 configs + delete kitsune direct
body:
### Summary

- BREAKING CHANGE - Removes conductor networking types "Proxy" ("proxy") and "Quic" ("quic"). Please transition to "WebRTC" ("webrtc").
- Deletes kitsune_direct testing framework, which was largely built around tx2, and awkwardly mocked out holochain, making it difficult to maintain. Please transition to using sweettest for network integration testing.

NOTE: this just comments out the configs, leaving open an easy revert in the tiny chance case that webrtc is not ready. We will need a follow-on PR to actually remove the tx2 code once we're sure we won't be going back.

### TODO:
- [x] CHANGELOG(s) updated with appropriate info
- [ ] Just before pressing the merge button, ensure new entries to CHANGELOG(s) are still under the _UNRELEASED_ heading

title: Integrate ability to "close" tx5 "connections"
body:
integrate https://github.com/holochain/tx5/pull/25:

Since tx5 endpoints work as a message queue, opening / retrying connections as needed under the hood, there isn't a direct analog for "Closing" a connection. Yet, holochain still needs this ability if we don't want to speak to a remote node.

This PR introduces the concept of a remote id "ban" where we won't send messages to, accept messages from, or allow connections to a particular remote id for a specified time length. We can consider / configure the length of this ban period in the holochain integration PR, but perhaps ~10 seconds would function as a starting point, since, if they try to re-establish a connection after that time period, we will simply ban them again.

title: enabling native ios, pre-conditions
body: ### Summary `hc pack` takes `--dylib-ios` in order that it should emit some `.dylib` files, and that the yaml/manifest should contain references to the files. The reason this is necessary is that to build for iOS and to ship your app, no [JIT-compiled](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Just-in-time_compilation) code is allowed, which is the default way that holochain+wasmer handle the wasm DNA code. With .dylib files, those native ios instructions can be codesigned and thus not a security vulnerability for iOS - [x] gives holochain the native ability to handle WasmDylibZome type zomes in addition to standard WasmZome. - [x] very fast wasm instruction execution time because there's no compile step during runtime - [x] minor refactor to consolidate wasmer related code Could be extended in the future for MacOS affordances and performance improvements. I don't believe that Android will need to make use of this, due to lesser security controls. Apple briefly experimented with allowing JIT in some beta versions of iOS, but subsequently disabled it again prior to release. (https://twitter.com/altstoreio/status/1354096048650809349). ### TODO: - [ ] CHANGELOG(s) updated with appropriate info - [ ] Just before pressing the merge button, ensure new entries to CHANGELOG(s) are still under the _UNRELEASED_ heading ### How it works 1. Use this in your build DNA command, note the --ios-serialize: hc dna pack --dylib-ios --output=happ/workdir/projects.dna happ/workdir/dna/projects When you run it, this will produce some additional files. You will need to add these to your iOS app project folder, and include those files in the final build of your iOS app. 2. Add lines in your dna.yaml file to each zome specifying where the wasm dylib file will be, relative to your IOS ROOT SOURCE FOLDER

title: Remove impossible HoloHash From conversions and make `HoloHash::retype()` private
body:
### Summary

We had a bunch of From impls going from essentially an enum (a sum type) into one of its variants, which is ill-advised because there's no guarantee that the enum is of the expected variant (like going from AnyDhtHash into EntryHash, when it was actually an ActionHash).

This removes those Froms and make `retype` private so this kind of unsafe "casting" can't be done.

title: fix(github/workflows/release): increase chances of successful pushing of source branch
body:
this mitigates an issue that occurred in the [most recent release][0].

```
Run set -xeu
  set -xeu
  git push origin ${HOLOCHAIN_SOURCE_BRANCH}
  shell: /usr/bin/bash -e {0}
  env:
    HOLOCHAIN_REPO: /var/tmp/holochain_repo
    CACHIX_REV: v1.2
    HOLOCHAIN_SOURCE_BRANCH: develop
+ git push origin develop
To https://github.com/holochain/holochain
 ! [rejected]        develop -> develop (fetch first)
error: failed to push some refs to 'https://github.com/holochain/holochain'
hint: Updates were rejected because the remote contains work that you do
hint: not have locally. This is usually caused by another repository pushing
hint: to the same ref. You may want to first integrate the remote changes
hint: (e.g., 'git pull ...') before pushing again.
hint: See the 'Note about fast-forwards' in 'git push --help' for details.
Error: Process completed with exit code 1.
```

0: https://github.com/holochain/holochain/actions/runs/4613614540/jobs/8166379124#step:13:1

title: Improve HoloHash::from_raw_32 and use it
body:
### Summary

`HoloHash:;from_raw_32` is the only way to create a fake hash that includes a valid checksum (final 4 bytes). I had a test in another branch that was failing because a test hash was being used in a context where the checksum was being checked. So, this just makes sure that that function always computes a proper checksum, and I use it where it matters.

### TODO:
- [ ] CHANGELOG(s) updated with appropriate info
- [ ] Just before pressing the merge button, ensure new entries to CHANGELOG(s) are still under the _UNRELEASED_ heading

title: fix(release-automation): consider dependency state of all matched crates
body:
forwardport of #2149

---

* fix(release-automation): consider dependency state of all matched crates

the change filter could lead to dependency changes not including the changed dependency in the release, if the selected crate itself didn't have any changed.

the blocked filter was removed because it adds unnecessary obfuscation.

* chore(release-automation): remove duplicate test

* test(relase-automation): cover the fixed case

* chore: add FIXME comment for a bug in the dependencies_in_workspace_filter function

* test(release-automation): extend dependency bump test to cover the transitive case

* refactor(release-automation/crate_selection): clarify transitive change detection

### Summary



### TODO:

- [ ] Just before pressing the merge button, ensure new entries to CHANGELOG(s) are still under the _UNRELEASED_ heading

title: AppManifest `version` becomes `installed_hash`
body:
### Summary

`version` is renamed to `installed_hash`, and now takes only a single DnaHashB64 rather than a list.

This will be used to look up existing DNAs upon app installation, to avoid the need to pass in DNAs multiple times when re-installing an app which has already been installed.

### TODO:
- [ ] CHANGELOG(s) updated with appropriate info
- [ ] Just before pressing the merge button, ensure new entries to CHANGELOG(s) are still under the _UNRELEASED_ heading

title: Include AppManifest in AppInfo
body:
### Summary

- Rewrites legacy app installation (sans bundles) to use AppBundle
- Returns AppManifest with AppInfo, with DNA `installed_hash` properly set
- Ensure that AppManifest returned from AppInfo can be used to install a new instance of the same app without the original bundle
